comment: make sure to submit everything on time late work is generally not accepted

She blows through the lessons, often skipping or cutting things short. She expects you to have perfectly memorized everything previous in the course, so by week 5 you HAVE to have everything down, or you'll fail the tests, quizzes, and projects. She often just teaches speaking Italian despite it being week 2, and you don't know what she's saying.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Amazing professor. She makes it easy to learn Italian. She cares more that you tried than your pronunciation. You will talk in Italian every class and to your classmates. 3 projects (can do with a partner) (easy), 3 quizzes on paper, 3 reflections, and homework. She is super sweet and very understanding. Makes Italian fun. TAKE HER!!!!

She is an ideal professor for a foreign language class. Class is fun and very interactive - you'll need to make friends in the class as socializing is important to learn the language. Definitely one of the best experiences I've had in college.

Professor Creekmur is very kind. Her class is super easy to understand and it is fun. You may have to present a couple presentations in class, but they are easy and quick. She makes the language easy to understand. Definitely take this class if you want to learn Italian.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor is literally the best. If you don't understand a topic, email her and she will give you the best run down you could get! She is very nice when communicating with her and she gives great feedback on assignments! Def. would take her course again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Do the work and it's an easy A. She's not super accessible by email but she'll get back to you in a few days. Assignments are not hard and she's fair and friendly. She includes a lot of links for practice if you want more. I found I didn't get enough practice with tenses etc but that's just because I need in person classes to be disciplined.

Reading through RMP something I really wanted to know before choosing a class was what the course work was like.. so heres to anyone that was wondering. She does voice threads also. Six (6) Quizzes @ 3% each Three (3) Cultural Blogs @ 4% each Online Discussions Boards (1 a week) 30% Two (1) Oral Exams @ 10% each One (1) Final Project 20%

I LOVE Professoressa Creekmur! She was my favorite part of the semester. Her classes were interactive, fun, and informative. If you come to class and do the online assignments, you'll pass for sure. Best thing is that the textbook is used for all of the Italian courses, so you won't have to buy another one when you take Italian 1002.

Not the easiest professor I've had, but not the hardest, either. She has high, but not unreasonable expectations, and is very kind and encouraging. I loved learning about different regions of Italy in this class and how knowledgeable she is about each of them.

There is homework and online discussions, but other than that it is basically watching Italian movies and chatting about them. I love Creekmur. I have taken her for every Italian class! Do the work, show up to class, easy A.

The class isnt hard at all but it definitely is tedious. Lots of outside of class requirements and busy work so despite the easy A I wouldn't retake her Everyone raves on here that she is so nice but she has the capacity to be rude to her students for sure so watch out for getting on her bad side. Also be prepared to be called on randomly.

I was so afraid of foreign language, but Creekmur changed that. If you have to take Italian, please take her! I will be taking her for ALL of my Italian classes until I finish the requirement. She is fair and doesn't expect you to know fluent Italian in a semester. She just wants to see you make an effort and improve. She is the best!

She is very nice and caring. The class is fairly easy, lots of online HW and be prepared to be called on in class every other minute. There are lots of random assignments along with 3 tests and 2 oral presentations.

Need Italian for a foreign language.. originally only took it because Spanish was full and ended up LOVING this class. If you pay attention in class and look over notes before exams guaranteed an A in the class. She makes learning a new language fun.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Just study a little and you should be okay. Take advantage of extra credit opportunities. Don't wait to do hours in the FLRC or Italian Table. She will work with you to make sure you understand everything. Don't forget to do the online homework. It is tedious but easy. Prof. Creekmur is sweet and offers help when asked. Just email her in advance.

Professor Creekmur is a great Italian teacher. You need to do the homework. She uses online homework and you can get the textbook through that instead of the bookstore or amazon. I preferred having the book in person but that's me. She's a very nice grader and she absolutely loves to talk and teach Italian. I definitely wanna take her again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I loved her! She is a wonderful and kind lady. Loves the language and is passionate. She will definitely help you out of you need help. She is very knowledgeable. Do your homework online!
Love her! I will be taking her next semester. She is so understanding and caring. She makes the class so fun and really exposes you to the culture.
Prof. Creekmur is my favorite teacher ever, I learned so much when I took her class. She is extremely flexible and gives you extra credit for doing fun things like showing up at international events.

She was so sweet, I took her just because I was interested in the language. She loves speaking it and talking about Italy. She is one of the best language teachers. Always remember the homework online before test, they help and she does it to see you at least finished it.

One of the best professors I've had. Prompt feedback on assignments and emails. Very understanding of legit challenges with completing assignments. You can tell she really wants her students to succeed. As with most other classes, put forth effort and you will do well.
Solid Italian professor. My 1102 prof (Elisabeta Weber) was better, but this was still a good professor. Learning a new language is never easy, but this professor did a good job helping us learn.
I took her for Italian just for fun and it was the basic start of the language. Its easy to get a B or A if you do your work and pay attention. And she will make sure you pass the class!
Super nice professor. Understands you won't master it in one semester. If you put effort into the class, you'll be fine.

The class gradually got more difficult. She was a good teacher, but sometimes would get boring. As long as you participate in class, do the online hw, and go to the foreign language lab, you'll do fine. 3 tests and  a couple projects! Last project is your final grade!

She is nice and she is a good teacher. She gives a detailed format for each test so you know exactly what to study and the tests aren't that hard. The class requires a decent amount of work but not too much.
She is so laid back. She understands that we won't master a language in a semester so she is pretty easy with grading. Gives study guide for tests and even the oral tests aren't bad. Def take her!
She is such a great teacher! Take her!

Such an awesome course. Took it as a hybrid, and she takes a point off your final grade for each absence after your second. Tests were a bit too complicated for the amount of time allotted, but overall, awesome class with an awesome professor.

Good professor. Learned a lot, plus it helped that she was a native to Italy. Helpful, but easily frustrated by those who don't even work. She expects you to put in some time to learn it. Great teacher!

Very nice lady. Very good at teaching Italian. Very satisfied with her and the course. Gives guide lines on what test will be. Requires online assignments to be done before each test, just an inconvenience. Attendance was required in begin but after a while she stopped taking it maybe because she learned our names

Professor Creekmur is an awesome Italian teacher.  She requires attendance and will mark off letter grades after so many absences.  Just go to class!  She is an easy grader and very understanding as long as you try.  I highly recommend her for any Italian class!!

Prof. Creekmur is the nicest professor that I have had yet at KSU! She enjoys teaching Italian as much as her students enjoy learning it. There are tons of group activities, cute movies and songs, and other curriculum that she incorporates to make learning Italian easier. Make sure to study, show up each class, and you'll pass with an A!

Great Professor!....Be responsible on your work and study and you will get a good grade. Also, you will learn to understand and speak Italian...I recommend her for any Italian Class you might need to take. You will enjoy learning a foreign language. Glad I had her  class.

I really enjoyed Prof. Creekmur's class.  Foreign language is not my thing, so I had to work really hard in the class.  She is extremely helpful and caring.  I would highly recommend Prof. Creekmur if you get a chance to be in her class.
She's great! She's so sweet and can answer any questions, because she is from Italy. Don't forget to do Quia though, it's automatically graded the due it's due.

Mrs. Creekmur is an amazing professor! She is so caring and understanding of everything. Class is super easy. Just show up, pay attention and it will be an EASY A! I love this class and I will be taking her for Italian 2001

she was such a sweet heart!...excellent teacher- she is very helpful and understanding of any kinds of problems you may have. Like someone else said- it is a foreign language so unless thats your thing- it wont be easy, but she did a great job to help me understand the harder parts. If you have the chance- definitely take her class.

AMAZING! She is such a nice, helpful and understanding teacher. I took her for ITAL 1001, 1002 and 2001. Not an "easy" A because it's foreign language, and that can be difficult for some people. But she makes it fun and easy to understand. I don't think I got anything lower than an A on the tests or any other assignments. TAKE HER!!

I would recomend her to anyone. She is great and she is a very nice teacher. She is flexable and will work with you and will help you with any questions you have. I loved her class so much I took her for 1002 also. Take her! She is great!
